summary: The Coastal Broadband Deployment Act aims to streamline the process of deploying or modifying communication facilities within floodplains. It exempts such projects from certain environmental and historical preservation reviews under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) and the National Historic Preservation Act (NHPA). The bill defines key terms like "covered project," "communications facility," and "Federal authorization," emphasizing that the Federal Communications Commission (Commission) has jurisdiction over these projects.
